net.hudup.core.client

Class RemoteServerCP

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • net.hudup.core.client.RemoteServerCP
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants, ServerStatusListener

    public class RemoteServerCP
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements ServerStatusListener
    This graphic user interface (GUI) as a window application JFrame allows users to start, stop, pause, resume, configure Server remotely. This class is also called powerful control panel for remote server, which shares many function which the lightweight control panel represented by LightRemoteServerCP. The difference from LightRemoteServerCP is to update server status immediately because this RemoteServerCP has two advanced features as follows:
    • This control panel is itself a ServerStatusListener that is registered with server before.
    • This control panel is itself a remote RMI object that allows other applications to interact with it via RMI protocol.
    Therefore, every time the server changes status, the server calls the method statusChanged(ServerStatusEvent) of this control panel to update server current status immediately.
    RMI is abbreviation of Java Remote Method Invocation for remote interaction in client-server architecture. The tutorial of RMI is available at https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/rmi.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public void statusChanged(ServerStatusEvent evt)

        Description copied from interface: ServerStatusListener

        Specified by:
        statusChanged in interface ServerStatusListener
        Parameters:
        evt - specified status event received from Server.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method shows the ConnectServerDlg for users to enter authenticated information to connect server. Later on this method shows the this control panel for users to start, stop, pause and configure sever remotely.
        Parameters:
        args - argument parameter of main method. It contains command line arguments.
